item.title: Defining Decade
item.description: resilient people are usually very likeable. clients with the toughest family backgrounds know the least about how to get what they want in love. why people choose cohabitation women want better access to love. men want easier access to sex. experiences high school and our twenties are the only time when we have the most self-defining memories adolescence is the time of our first attempt to form life stores.

item.title: on Lee Kuan Yew
item.description: I found myself thinking about what Lee Kuan Yew had to say about many things a lot recently. While I know close to nothing about him, I can imagine that most of his thoughts and actions stemmed from a systemic and practical approach. I remember reading him stating that while he takes a certain liking to some ideas, he is only interested in what works in real life. This Machiavellian approach to problems reminds me of one of Charlie Munger’s lessons in life: avoid extremely intense ideology.
